channel.title: Comments on: PIC18F2550 USB HID IO
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: AndrejK
item.dc:creator: AndrejK
item.description: Project was flashed successfull with WinPic->FT232BL->COM84 analog of JDM ( Extra Pic ) with buffers on KT315B,LM7812,LM7805 (2<em>1N4148 after line Vpp ,68nf to GND and 2.2k to Vcc5v, 100nF on Vusb (pin 14), 20MHz quartz and 2</em>15...22 pF ) . OpenProg 0.9.0 was flashed successfull also (12 MHz).
item.content:encoded: Project was flashed successfull with WinPic->FT232BL->COM84 analog of JDM ( Extra Pic ) with buffers on KT315B,LM7812,LM7805 (21N4148 after line Vpp ,68nf to GND and 2.2k to Vcc5v, 100nF on Vusb (pin 14), 20MHz quartz and 215…22 pF ) . OpenProg 0.9.0 was flashed successfull also (12 MHz).

item.title: By: Tee Dee
item.dc:creator: Tee Dee
item.description: Just for clarity... The hex files are in separate links from the .c code. Click on the words "(hex)" and you will be taken to the hex file(s).
item.content:encoded:
Just for clarity…
The hex files are in separate links from the .c code. Click on the words “(hex)” and you will be taken to the hex file(s).

item.title: By: Carlo
item.dc:creator: Carlo
item.description:
Thanks for sharing your project but couldn't help to spot a few problems: Code: if (theCRC = in_data[7]) { Classic '=' instead of '=='. Now the test for a valid CRC will always succeed, except for a CRC value zero, then the program won't do what you expect.
Consequent use of '&' instead of '&&'. The code works but doesn't show its intention.
Inside the serial interrupt routine it is not required to disable the Global interrupt as the hardware is doing this automatically. A few lines lower however, enabling the Global interrupt again is a bug. Normally the hardware handles this too. If another interrupt is waiting to be served then it would fire immediately, not allowing the current interrupt to restore its saved context with undefined behaviour as a result
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for sharing your project but couldn’t help to spot a few problems:
Code:
if (theCRC = in_data[7]) {
Classic ‘=’ instead of ‘==’.
Now the test for a valid CRC will always succeed, except for a CRC value zero, then the program won’t do what you expect.

Consequent use of ‘&’ instead of ‘&&’. The code works but doesn’t show its intention.

Inside the serial interrupt routine it is not required to disable the Global interrupt as the hardware is doing this automatically. A few lines lower however, enabling the Global interrupt again is a bug. Normally the hardware handles this too. If another interrupt is waiting to be served then it would fire immediately, not allowing the current interrupt to restore its saved context with undefined behaviour as a result

item.title: By: vicky

item.content:encoded:
Hi everyone,

item.title: By: PLAAHemantha
item.dc:creator: PLAAHemantha
item.description: hi everybody! i'm trying to sending a data from PIC and get and display it from PC using VB6(such as numeric value). But i could not success. I could not find correct Schematic and vb program. I have some knowledge about VB6 but i have little knowledge about PIC. I want to send a numeric value from PIC and get and display it on PC, or send pulse from PIC then get and count pulses given time interval and display it on PC Anyone can help me? Hemantha
item.content:encoded:
hi everybody!
i’m trying to sending a data from PIC and get and display it from PC using VB6(such as numeric value). But i could not success. I could not find correct Schematic and vb program. I have some knowledge about VB6 but i have little knowledge about PIC.
I want to send a numeric value from PIC and get and display it on PC, or send pulse from PIC then get and count pulses given time interval and display it on PC
Anyone can help me?
Hemantha
